job_title: Life Enrichment Assistant in Loch Raven, MD
pros: Health coverage is covered 100%. If you are there in a PRN basis, there's a good chance they'll hire you if your good enough.
cons: Management is too overbearing. No one in upper management knows what they're doing and it shows to the other workers. Micromanaging is prevalent there. There's no way for you to advance unless you're a nurse.

pros: Very good environment, Patients are nice (sisters), managers are very understanding and helpful. Would definitely recommend that place to work
cons: They have their own culture and their own routines of prayers since they are catholic sisters. They don't make you do it. It's a very quiet environment and you have to be very respectful of people space, intimacy and routine

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Caring and compassionate co-workers, students are (for the most part) respectful and motivated, majority of parents are supportive and encouraging.
cons: Some parents are over-involved and will not allow their child to grow into independence to the point of making demands/ultimatums of faculty/staff; administration is critical and non-supportive of the professionals on staff.

pros: fun to work at and has great benefits. I would work here if I were not moving out of state.
cons: I think the residents need to be more independent and our staff needs to show them things so they can be out.

pros: I enjoy being able to contribute to the welcome spirit that exists among the resident Sisters. Confidentiality is a high priority and as receptionist I am trusted with a high quantity and variety of information. Dialogue and collaboration are primary work components for serving at NDEG.
cons: Organization within this position is sometimes 'over the top.'
